content: cream shells crocheted bag designed by beverly button materials bernat softee chunky yarn 4 skeins of natural crochet hook size n vinyl or faux leather in brown ½ size brown grosgrain ribbon 1 ½ yards 2 d rings gold cream satin 1 yard 1 large snap quilting thread in natural or cream finished size 10 ½ tall 13 wide instructions with 2 strands of yarn together chain 27 round 1 2 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook double_crochet in each chain across in last chain work 6 double_crochet double_crochet in each chain down opposite side of foundation chain end with 3 double_crochet in starting chain join with slip_stitch to top of chain-3 round 2 chain 3 3 double_crochet in same st * skip 2 sts 4 double_crochet in next st repeat from * around ending with skip 2 sts slip_stitch in top of chain-3 round 3 slip_stitch in first double_crochet and in space before next 2 double_crochet of shell chain 3 3 double_crochet in same space * 4 double_crochet in middle space of next shell repeat from * around end with slip_stitch in top of chain-3 rnds 4 13 repeat round 3 rnds 14 - 16 chain 1 single_crochet in same space single_crochet in each st around slip_stitch in top of first single_crochet fasten yarn weave in ends lay bag on folded piece of satin cut 2 pieces for lining being careful to cut 5/8 away from bag for seam allowance if you want a double lining cut 4 pieces sew sides and bottom of lining together trimming and finishing seams turn under ½ of top of lining twice then stitch cut 2 pieces of vinyl 2 ½ x 4 turn under ½ along each side and stitch i used the natural thread for contrast fold these 2 pieces wrong sides together after slipping through d rings and pin in place at each end of bag opening place lining satin side in if you have used only a single lining in bag aligning seams and making sure that top of lining is level with top of 2nd round of single_crochet sew in place with double row of stitching approximately ¼ apart cut 3 ½ x 35 strip of vinyl for bag strap turn under ¼ along each side then fold strap wrong side together and stitch 1/8 from edge slip ends of strap through d rings turn under 4 and stitch in place tie 6 grosgrain ribbon in a double knot tightly around stitched area trim ends for another look pierce both layers of strap with an awl then use a grommet to hold each end of strap in place thread grosgrain ribbon through the spaces between each shell in top row of shells tie in a bow trim ends sew large snap inside top of bag at front and back note you can change the width of this bag very easily by adding or subtracting chains in the foundation row work rounds of shells until the bag is the
